verses.roman:
śuka-śārikā prabhura hāte uḍi' paḍe
prabhuke śunāñā kṛṣṇera guṇa-śloka paḍe

synonyms: śuka-śārikā—the parrots, male and female; prabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; hāte—on the hand; uḍi'-flying; paḍe—fall; prabhuke—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; śunāñā—causing to hear; kṛṣṇera—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; guṇa-śloka paḍe—chanted verses about the transcendental qualities.
translation: Both parrots flew onto the hand of the Lord and began to chant the transcendental qualities of Kṛṣṇa, and the Lord listened to them.
